intro: Myrosma membranacea, commonly known as the membranous myrosma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish in color, and it produces small, hairy pods that contain its seeds. Myrosma membranacea is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
